page.title: 19THE POLICE FORCE
page.content: The central police station is at Bexleyheath, but there are also stations at Belvedere, Erith and Sidcup. The most common call is to burglaries. Last year there were a hundred thousand false alarms. A policemans duty is made up of three shifts, or turns, the early turn from 06.00 to 14.00hrs., the late turn from 14.00 to 22.00 hrs., and night duty from 22.00 to 06.00hrs. Each turn has an inspector, three sergeants and twelve constables of whom, three drive Panda cars and two drive the area car. There are three cells in Bexleyheath Police Station which is in "R" Division. The police must be qualified First-Aiders. Two men are permanently in the communications room.
